text: Alma G. Stallworth (November 15, 1932 â€“ August 25, 2020) was an American Democratic politician and businesswoman. She was in the Michigan House of Representatives from 1971 to 1974, 1983 to 1996 and from 2003 to 2004. She also founded the Black Caucus Foundation of Michigan in 1985.Advisory Council PDF . Retrieved on December 11, 2007. Stallworth was born in Little Rock, Arkansas.Stallworth, Alma G. . Retrieved on December 11, 2007. Stallworth died on August 25, 2020 in Detroit, Michigan at the age of 87.Alma Stallworth, longtime Detroit lawmaker and trailblazer, dies at 87 ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Businesspeople from Little Rock, Arkansas Category:Businesspeople from Detroit Category:Politicians from Detroit Category:Politicians from Little Rock, Arkansas Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Alma G. Stallworth
